Introduction
Imagine: Last weekend you met up with a friend for lunch. When you mentioned you were feeling worried and uncertain about your future, she told you about an organization in the city that offers mental health counseling and career guidance to working women. The organization is called Daisy Services and it operates as a not-for-profit organization. It is not a business. It also is not a government agency. The community organization was set up to help working women improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. Your friend heard about {b}Daisy Services{/b} from her older sister who has been feeling lost and unmotivated to work ever since her husband died. She received counseling services at {b}Daisy Services{/b} for six months and is now feeling better. She also mentioned that the organization offers a variety of services, including meditation, and even free childcare for individuals receiving counseling services.
